✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It was fun to implement to calculation, the only thing I would add is the result of the entropy in the 'hello' example.

import math
result=''
entromax=0
for word in [input() for i in range(int(input()))]:
  entropy=0
  for i in list(dict.fromkeys(word)):
    x=word.count(i)/len(word)
    entropy+=-x*math.log2(x)
  if entropy>entromax:
    entromax=entropy
    result=word
print(result)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Looks good!

I tested the puzzle in C#, everything is clear and works fine. I think the statement could be shortened a bit. There are two character probability formulas showing the same thing, one would be enough, maybe example calculation can be simplified too.

There is a equally-ranked highest entropy in test 5 (mine! I didn’t checked!):

/!\ ex-aequo: len(set(entropies)) = 2 < 3 = len(entropies)
entropy(0101010101010) = 0.9957274520849255
entropy(0010111011010) = 0.9957274520849255

So there is two solution:
1. Allow case with many highest entropy words in test/validator and explain in the statement what to do (print the first, the last, all)
2. Change test 5 and ban equally-ranked highest entropy words (the simplest solution :-) )

I have a last comment (before approval :-) ) about test again.

— Adding a “big” test with many word, for example synonyms:
22

— Have closer test-validator, for example, test 5 is binary numbers, so validator 5 would be binary numbers too, but differents, and with a different number of them. Doing so allow to have every good ideas of test/validator visibles by the players, as for example yours for validator 5, it would be nice to the players to see a test of this kind:

2
z_is_a_no_frequent_letter
e_is_a_frequent_letter

e.g.:

3

1_is_the_bigest_digit
+_is_not_a_digit

IMPORTANT: I did not check in the example above if there is equally-ranked highest entropy words.
By the way, I think you should add that there is no ex-aequo in the constraints (if you want there is no equally-ranked highest entropy words).

EDIT: I checked, there is no equally-ranked highest entropy words in examples above :-)

I just saw that the oldest comment is 6 days old and it remains 24 days to validate, so I infer that you put your puzzle directly as “ready” and not “WIP” (work in progress).
I would advise you to always put your puzzle in “WIP” before for two reasons:
1. A lot of people could have good ideas of improvement, “WIP” mode let some time to them.
2. This times allows also people to upvote your puzzle, and you earn 10xp at each one of them :-) (I recently earn 780xp and got to lvl20 like this :-D !)

I allowed myself to make some modifications to the statement, I hope you won’t blame me!
(I kept a backup of the old version if you want to restore it :-) ).
It would have been too long by the comments!
— My proposition to code-format "hello" was bad because newline are automatically inserted around, that spans the text over too many line: ugly and unclear!
— The ascii formulas was too large for the ide (especially for people with not full HD screen!), I replaced them by shorter ascii-art version.
— I put *Goal* before *Calculation* because when you do a clash, you want to know what to do before how to do it :-) 
— I shortened a few sentence (for quicker reading)
— And some typos.

Very nice idea, I like it :-). Entropy and information theory is very elegant and powerfull.

Before giving approval, it would be nice to improve the typography of the statement:
— using code formatting (with back-quote `) around stuff like:
"hello"
[p(h) = 0.2 , p(e) = 0.2 , p(l) = 0.4, p(o) = 0.2]
-p(h) * log_2(p(h)) + -p(e) * log_2(p(e)) + -p(l) * log_2(p(l)) + -p(o) * log_2(p(o))
= -0.2 * log_2(0.2) + -0.2 * log_2(0.2) + -0.4 * log_2(0.4) + -0.2 * log_2(0.2) 
— clarify the formula above (in particular by replacing “+ -” by “-” alone):
`entropy = -p(h) * log_2(p(h)) - p(e) * log_2(p(e)) - p(l) * log_2(p(l)) - p(o) * log_2(p(o))
= -0.2 * log_2(0.2) - 0.2 * log_2(0.2) - 0.4 * log_2(0.4) - 0.2 * log_2(0.2)`
— removing «-» in front of title (Explanations, Calculation, Goal): new line above and bold font is enough to highlight them.

About test case:
— Did you mean to not have ex-aequo case?
— It would be nice to add a few more test case (to add some diversity), e.g.:
– an “extreme” one:
2
abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz
aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa
– a non-letter one:
3
tan(x) = sin(x) / cos(x)
cot(x) = cos(x) / sin(x)
cos(x)^2 + sin(x)^2 = 1
– a binary one:
3
0101010101010
0010111011010
0000001110000

def calcul_entropy(w):
    d={}
    for i in w:
        d[i]=d.get(i,0)+1
    return(sum(map(lambda x: -x * math.log2(x),[d[i]/len(w) for i in d])))

n = int(input())
r = ''

for i in range(n):
    word = input()
    d1[word]=calcul_entropy(word)

print(max(d1,key=d1.get))
